thread.section_title: Business News, Economy, Finance & ASX Market News
thread.title: Market Wrap: Former home of Phoenix Biscuit Company sells for $2.7m
thread.title_full: Market Wrap: Former home of Phoenix Biscuit Company sells for $2.7m

author: The Sydney Morning Herald
title: Market Wrap: Former home of Phoenix Biscuit Company sells for $2.7m
text:
The former home of the Phoenix Biscuit Company has been sold in a private sale. Photo: Supplied
SALES
Bundoora
A single-level takeaway food store in Hawthorn has been sold subject to a five-year lease. Photo: Supplied
A large corner development site in MAB Corporation's University Hill precinct at 222 Plenty Road has been sold. Butera & Company's Robert Butera said the 8224-square-metre block next to the Metropolitan Ring Road was the last available corner site in the precinct. He said it had "massive exposure". It sold for $3.75 million or about $450 per square metre.
Abbottsford
A stylish converted warehouse at 41 Grosvenor Street that was once the home of the Phoenix Biscuit Company has been sold for $2.7 million. Gray Johnson agent Rory White said the private sale of the corner property was negotiated with a leaseback offer from the vendor to enter a three-year lease at an annual rental of $153,000 net. The restored two-level building was sold in conjunction with an adjoining vacant block at 8 Southampton Crescent.
Derrimut
Stone Elegance has bought a 900-square-metre warehouse at 89 East Derrimut Crescent in the West Park Industrial Estate. The $850,000 deal was negotiated by Industry Property Group's Stuart Macqueen . IPG also negotiated the sale of a 2515-square-metre parcel in stage 1 of the new Maidstone Business Park in Altona North for developer Cadence Property. Cadence recently purchased the estate in an off-market transaction.
Hawthorn East
Group 4 has sold 385 Tooronga Road for $2.75 million at a yield of 7.1 per cent to a private investor. JLL's Josh Tebb said the stand-alone office building near the corner of Tooronga Road and Toorak Road was built less than five years ago.
Hawthorn
A investor has paid $1.26 million at auction for a securely leased retail property at 347-349 Burwood Road. Teska Carson's Tom Maule and Adrian Boutsakis said the shop attracted strong interest as four bidders pushed the price past the reserve. The single-level takeaway food store was sold subject to a five-year lease from July 2012, with a five-year option, at a rental of $70,303 per annum with 4 per cent annual increases.
Glen Iris
A residential development site at 1520 High Street and 65 Erica Avenue was sold by Colliers International's Ben Baines , Ted Dwyer and Hamish Burgess for $3.4 million. The deal with a local developer resulted in a rate per square metre of $4096. "Both owners received approximately 30 per cent more through the process of selling to a developer, as opposed to selling individually as houses," Mr Baines said.
LEASES
Elwood
Hanoi Hannah, Saigon Sally and Tokyo Tina are set to get a sibling. Fitzroys' Dan Noonan has leased 24 Ormond Road to the operators of the popular Asian eateries. The deal for 105 square metres on the ground floor was struck at $50,000 net per annum on an initial term of five years, with two further options. Vietnamese restaurants Hanoi Hannah and Saigon Sally were joined by Tokyo Tina earlier this year to complete a trio of casual, modern Asian dining destinations.
Melbourne
CEL Properties has signed new leases with Wingate Consumer Finance and United Recruitment, both for three years, at 420 St Kilda Road. The rents were undisclosed. However, rates in the building are about $300 per square metre net. JLL's Richard Norman said Wingate Consumer Finance favoured the property because of the functional fit-out. United Recruitment, an existing occupier, had explored the market to relocate but renewed for a three-year lease, he said.
Melbourne
Dr Boom Communications has signed a lease to launch its first Melbourne store. Colliers International's Mike Crittenden and Allard Shelton's Patrick Barnes negotiated the deal. The Sydney-based mobile repairs and accessories operator, with more than 10 stores, will open in Shop 6 at 253-267 Bourke Street. It will take the 31-square-metre space at undisclosed rent for five years. Dr Boom was expanding rapidly across the country, Mr Crittenden said.
Richmond
PelicanCorp has leased 800 square metres on the second level of 600 Victoria Street at a rent reported to be in the mid-$300s per square metre net with minimal incentive, on a five-year term. JLL's Matt Brown-Greaves said the inner east was becoming more popular. PelicanCorp joins the growing list of premium tenants, including Ford Australia and Emerald Grain, on long-term leases in the Salta Properties-owned building.
Sunshine West
Industry Property Group has leased a 497-square-metre office/warehouse at 16 Technology Drive for two years to a community-based tenant. The first-year rental would start at $80 per square metre, Stuart Macqueen said.
Mulgrave
Beonic Technologies has taken 650 square metres in Building 2 at 195 Wellington Road for an undisclosed rent for five years. Asking rentals in the park are about $300 per square metre net, plus outgoings and car parking. JLL's Michael Simonds negotiated the deal in the four-level office. It is one of six campus-style buildings in the park.
MOVERS
Colliers International is adding to its industrial team in Victoria with the appointment of a new city fringe and Port Melbourne specialist, Clinton Ramm . Mr Ramm moves from Lucas Commercial.
Submissions to sjohanson@fairfaxmedia.com.au
